predicate.note: Frames file for 'run' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'work'

roleset.name: operate, procede
roleset.note: For additional examples for this sense/roleset, refer to work.01

example.name: agentive
example.text: Mr. Stromach wants to resume a more influential role in *trace* running the company.

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: Construction spending ran at an annual rate of $415.6 billion.
example.arg: at an annual rate of $415.6 billion

roleset.note: Could be interpreted as "walk quickly" sense also.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: 65% or more of Brazil's newly made automobiles run on alcohol.
example.arg: 65% or more of Brazil's newly made automobiles

roleset.name: walk quickly

example.name: high aspirations
example.text: John decided to run for President of the United States of America, figuring that if a big lummox like George W. could do it, so could he.
example.arg: President of the United States of America

roleset.note: I am so going to get in trouble for that.

example.name: ergative race
example.text: The Boston Marathon runs over Labor Day weekend.

roleset.note: Probably more natural as a passive: "The Boston Marathon is run over Labor Day weekend."

example.name: with direction
example.text: A good number decide it's not worth it and run for home.

roleset.note: Beware of "run out of the room", which could be misinterpreted as the phrasal "run_out".

example.name: with pole position
example.text: The fact is that as a savings or investment vehicle, insurance generally runs a poor second to any direct investment you might make in the same things the insurance company is putting your money into.
example.arg: as a savings or investment vehicle
a poor second to any direct investment you might make in the same things the insurance ocmpany is putting your money into

example.name: with buyer
example.text: Mad Dog, on the other hand, will run you a buck a bottle.
example.note: I have no idea how much Mad Dog actually costs, just for the record.

example.name: extend
example.text: A variety of special interest amendments, running from an import exemption for a California airplane museum to a small but intriguing struggle among sugar producing nations over the fate of Panama's quota of exports to the profitable US market.
example.arg: A variety of special interest amendments
an import exemption for a California airplane museum
a small but intriguing struggle among sugar producing nations over the fate of Panama's quota of exports to the profitable US market.

example.name: not from corpus
example.text: John ran into problems with his dissertation. Again. And again.

example.name: running guns
example.text: The CIA hired John *trace* to run guns into Peoria.

example.name: without medium
example.text: The magazine's editors ran a giant diagram of the product with arrows pointing to the packaging's polystyrene foam, polyproplene and polyester film -- all plastic items they say are non-biodegradable.
example.arg: a giant diagram of the product with arrows pointing to the packaging's polystyrene foam, polyproplene and polyester film -- all plastic items they say are non-biodegradable.

example.name: with medium
example.text: John ran a series of dirty haiku in the Daily Pennsylvanian.

roleset.name: run out: exhaust

example.name: ergative
example.text: ...before the number of available nations runs out.

example.name: with beneficiary
example.text: ``We flat ran out of financing resources,'' Mr. Jerritts said.

roleset.note: Compare to the "walk quickly" roleset id="run.08" above.

example.name: poor planning
example.text: The ruling could lead to the cancellation of huge bank debts *trace* the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham ran up *trace* after losing heavily on swap transactions.
example.arg: the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
after losing heavily on swap transactions
